chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander M Watson-Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Hearing May 7, 2014.

03-25-16/ Restitution in the amount of $2,165.00, payable to Denise J..
to be paid Joint & Several with Alexander Watson-Wright, to be paid prior to costs and surcharges over the period of Probation.   Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Pay all applicable costs, surcharges and assessments over period of probation.  Upon successful completion of any balance remaining  unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.  Upon revocation, through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b0 and as a condition of Extended supervision. Any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment  against the defendant.
Seek and maintain full time employment.  Obtain HSED or GED.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictios:  firearm possession; voting.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No driving without a valid license.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: Huber for work or school conditional upon absolute sobriety.  Credit for four days.

records.addlTxt: -Restitution be paid prior to costs / surcharges.  Restitution in the amount of $2,165 to Denise J joint and several with Alexander Watson-Wright(14CF55) J&S with 14CF53/ Michael Salinas over period of probation.  Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant
Original Transcript (16 pages) commencing 04/01/2014 PLEA & SENTENCING received and filed.
Request for payment of $68 witness fees for witness Denise J. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26198815 in court 4x on 2/18/14, 4/1/14, 5/7/14, 6/4/14.
Defendant was in custody at the time bench warrant issued.   lfc
Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 6/4/14 for Denise J. for 4 appearances on 2/18/14, 4/1/14, 5/7/14, 6/4/14.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Attorney Ronald C Shikora appeared.  Lucy J Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  kmw

Attorney Ronald C Shikora in court.  James Shikora appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued and STAYED.  Calendar call scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  kmw

Defendant Alexander M Watson-Wright in court with attorney Ronald C. Shikora.  Zach Wittchow under supervision of Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
**********
Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 42 months, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 months; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 months.  This sentence stayed and defendant place on PROBATION for a period of 3 years.  Upon revocation, the defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Terms of probation and extended supervision:
-6 months condition time in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days time served; Huber for work or school conditional upon absolute sobriety.
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with the Department
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment
-Cognitive Intervention Program
-Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-Seek and maintain full time employment
-Obtain HSED or GED
-No driving without valid license
The Court ordered the defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges and assessments over period of probation.  Upon successful completion any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.  Upon revocation, through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant
The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample pay surcharge over period of probation.  Upon successful completion any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.  Upon revocation, through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 
Filed,
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement (copy given to defendant);
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Motion to expunge DENIED.
**********
Restitution held open pending hearing on MAY 7, 2014, 1:30pm.  kmw

Defendant in court with Attorney Ron Shikora.  Zac Wittchow under supervision of Tyrone St. Junior for the State of Wisconsin.
State files an AMENDED INFORMATION as to Count 1:  the court amended the charge to Operating a Motor Vehicle Without Owners Consent PTAC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.23(3), 939.50(3)(i), 939.05 , a class I FELONY.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  kmw

Defendant Alexander M Watson-Wright in court with attorney Ronald C. Shikora.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel recently appointed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alexander M Watson-Wright in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to conflict of interest, motion granted forthwith.  Status conference scheduled for March 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Alexander M Watson-Wright in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alexander M Watson-Wright in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Josh Mathy for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Alexander M Watson-Wright in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Alexander M Watson-Wright in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
